text: The discus throw event at the 1930 Women's World Games was held in Prague at the Letná Stadium, with the qualification and final being held on 7 September 1930. 20 athletes from 12 nations competed in the event. ==Entrants== In August 1930 entrants were published of the athletes of 5 nations: the Netherlands, Sweden, Switzerland, Italy and Great Britain. Listed below are the athletes from these nations who were entered for the discus throw event. Nationality Name ==Results== ===Qualification=== The qualification took place in the morning of 7 September 1930, under bad weather conditions. Polish Halina Konopacka won the qualification ahead of German Tilly Fleischer and Italian Vittorina Vivenza. Swedish Elsa Svensson, Latvian Karlson and British Weston also qualified. The Dutch Dora Wevers had three invalid throws and so didn't qualify. Rank Name Nationality Distance Notes 1 Halina Konopacka 36.29 m Q 2 Tilly Fleischer 35.82 m Q 3 Vittorina Vivenza 35.32 m Q 4 Elsa Svensson 34.5 m Q 5 Elfriede Karlson 34.2 m Q 6 Mark Weston 33.7 m Q 7 ? 8 ? ? ? \- Dora Wevers -, -, - ===Final=== The final took place in the afternoon of 7 September. The weather was still bad. Rank Name Nationality Distance Notes Halina Konopacka 36.80 Tilly Fleischer 35.82 Vittorina Vivenza 35.23 4 Elfriede Karlson 34.74 5 Elsa Svensson 34.32 6 Mark Weston 33.70 Source: ==References== Category:Athletics at the 1930 Women's World Games
title: Athletics at the 1930 Women's World Games – discus throw
